application

Enum Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Client>
      • application.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Client>

    public enum Client
extends java.lang.Enum<Client>
    The main class of ChattApp 2.0 Client side. It uses the Singleton design pattern. Controls all the connection from the server to different connected clients.
    Author:
    Fredrik Johansson, Mattias Edin

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      INSTANCE

      • init

        public void init(GUI_Interface_Client gui)
        This is the initialize method, it uses a GUI and setup the connection towards the name server (DNS).
        Parameters:
        gui - The GUI to be used with the client, needs to implement GUI_Interface_Client.java.

      • addToServer

        public ToServer addToServer(java.lang.String server_ip,
                   int server_port,
                   java.lang.String topic,
                   int nr_clients)
                     throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                            java.io.IOException
        This method creates a new ToServer object and returns it.
        Parameters:
        server_ip - IP of server.
        server_port - Port of server.
        topic - The topic of the server.
        nr_clients - Number of currently connected clients.
        Returns:
        A new ready to connect server connection, defined by the values received.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Thrown to indicate that the IP address of a host could not be determined.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

      • connectToServer

        public void connectToServer(ToServer server,
                   java.lang.String nick)
                     throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Make the connection to a server with preferred nickname.
        Parameters:
        server - Server to connect to.
        nick - Preferrd nickname to connect with.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Thrown to indicate that the IP address of a host could not be determined.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

      • getListOfServers

        public void getListOfServers()
        Getter for the list of available servers.

      • addServer

        public void addServer(ToServer server)
        Add a server to the list of available. This method invokes the runLater method of the GUI, and sends a new thread as a parameter. The GUI then runs the run method when possible.
        Parameters:
        server - The server to add.

      • removeServer

        public void removeServer(ToServer server)
        Removes a available server from the list. This method invokes the runLater method of the GUI, and sends a new thread as a parameter. The GUI then runs the run method when possible.

      • updateServer

        public void updateServer(ToServer newServer,
                ToServer oldServer)
        Updates replaces a server with another server in the list of available server. This method invokes the runLater method of the GUI, and sends a new thread as a parameter. The GUI then runs the run method when possible.
        Parameters:
        newServer - The updated server.
        oldServer - The server to replace.

      • clearServers

        public void clearServers()
        Clears the list of available servers. This method invokes the runLater method of the GUI, and sends a new thread as a parameter. The GUI then runs the run method when possible.

      • addUser

        public void addUser(User user)
        Adds a user to the list of connected users and updates the list of available servers with the new connected user count. This method invokes the runLater method of the GUI, and sends a new thread as a parameter. The GUI then runs the run method when possible.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to add.

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser(User user)

        Parameters:
        user - The user to remove.

      • updateUser

              User oldUser)

        Parameters:
        newUser - The user to replace with.
        oldUser - The user to be updated.

      • clearUsers

        public void clearUsers()
        Clears the list users currently also connected to the connected server. This method invokes the runLater method of the GUI, and sends a new thread as a parameter. The GUI then runs the run method when possible.

        Parameters:
        topc - The new topic in string format.

      • println

        public void println(int timeStamp,
           java.lang.String str)
        Tells the GUI to print a string to the user of the interface with a specific time-stamp. This method invokes the runLater method of the GUI, and sends a new thread as a parameter. The GUI then runs the run method when possible.
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - The time-stamp to be used.
        str - The string to print.

      • getUserInfo

        public void getUserInfo(User user,
               ToServer server)
                 throws java.net.SocketException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Tells an object of the class ToServer to ask the connected server about information of a specific user also connected to the server.
        Parameters:
        user - The user in question.
        server - The currently connected server.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - Thrown to indicate that there is an error creating or accessing a Socket.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

      • getNick

        public java.lang.String getNick(ToServer server)
        Getter for the currently used nickname on a specific server.
        Parameters:
        server - The server in question.
        Returns:
        The requested nickname.

      • changeNick

        public void changeNick(java.lang.String nick,
              ToServer server)
                throws java.net.SocketException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Tells an object of the class ToServer to tell the connected server that this connected client wants to change in to a new nickname.
        Parameters:
        nick - The preferred nick.
        server - The server to perform the action.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - Thrown to indicate that there is an error creating or accessing a Socket.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

        Returns:

              throws java.net.SocketException,
                     java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

      • getCryptKey

        public java.lang.String getCryptKey(ToServer server)
        Getter for the currently used encryption/decryption key from a specific server.
        Parameters:
        server - The server in question.
        Returns:
        The encryption key currently used on the specific server.

      • setCryptKey

        public void setCryptKey(java.lang.String cryptKey,
               ToServer server)
        Setter for the currently used encryption/decryption key on a specific server.
        Parameters:
        cryptKey - The new encryption/decryption key.
        server - The server connection on witch to set the new key.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(ToServer server,
               int type,
               java.lang.String text)
                 throws java.net.SocketException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        WrongCryptTypeException
        Sends a message to a connected server.
        Parameters:
        server - The server in question.
        type - The type of the message. (MsgTypes.TEXT, MsgTypes.COMP, MsgTypes.CRYPT, MsgTypes.COMPCRYPT)
        text - The text to send.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - Thrown to indicate that there is an error creating or accessing a Socket.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        WrongCryptTypeException - Thrown to indicate that it has ben used a unknown MsgType. The known Msg.Types is as follows: MsgType.TEXT MsgType.COMP MsgType.CRYPT MsgType.COMPCRYPT
